qas.question: On what charge was Li Ying jailed for?
Who was responsible for imprisoning Li Ying?
During what type of crisis did Emperor Huan alienate the bureaucracy?
Students from what university led a protest against members of Huan's court?

context: Students from the <a3_0>Imperial<a3_0/> University organized a widespread student protest against the eunuchs of Emperor Huan's court. Huan further alienated the bureaucracy when he initiated grandiose construction projects and hosted thousands of concubines in his harem at a time of <a2_0>economic<a2_0/> crisis. <a1_0>Palace eunuchs<a1_0/> imprisoned the official Li Ying (李膺) and his associates from the Imperial University on a dubious charge of <a0_0>treason<a0_0/>. In 167 AD, the Grand Commandant Dou Wu (d. <a4_0>168 AD<a4_0/>) convinced his son-in-law, Emperor Huan, to release them. However the emperor permanently barred Li Ying and his associates from serving in office, marking the beginning of the Partisan Prohibitions.
